settings.title: Head of Support / Lead Engineer
settings.summary: Microsoft Certified professional with vast industry experience in IT, networking, solution architecture, and infrastructure management with a keen focus on security.

items.description: Orchestrating and improving support services. Leading a team of engineers, cultivating continuous improvement. Developing and implementing support strategy. Streamlining support processes.
Supporting Multi-Site and Multi Server hyper converged setups. Capacity planning, renewing, building and installing solutions for business projects. Training and tutoring engineers.

Covering the basics from installing printers to maintaining and installing Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange and Windows Server 2003 to 2016 as well as Linux servers, Hyper-V and VMWare solutions. Supporting Multi-Site and Multi Server heterogenous setups.

Develop appropriate IT strategies based on business goals while providing impact assessments and remediation strategies across all core application systems. Supply proactive, hands-on support to users across the business.
Maintain servers, telephone systems and network infrastructure. Worldwide support of remote offices. Responsible for company wide data backups. On call support engineer for internal staff.
Build, repair and maintain customers computers. Telephone support for customers. Responsible for hardware and software inventories for both in house IT as well as customers equipment

items.title: Design and build multi tiered web hosting for Drupal
items.description: I was the project lead for a major customer initiative involving the deployment of segregated application and database servers for a leading European car and van manufacturer. The solution was built on Debian Linux servers with fully isolated staging and production environments to ensure robust data security and compliance. Additionally, I implemented HAProxy to load-balance the web servers and manage TLS security certificates, providing a secure and highly available architecture for the customer’s applications.

items.title: Pandemic Helpdesk
items.description: During the 2020 COVID-19 pandemic, I was serving as Head of Support. This period brought significant new responsibilities as we transitioned rapidly from an office based environment to fully remote working. Although each engineer already had the capability to work from home, it was my responsibility to ensure that our high support standards were maintained. I achieved this by coordinating the team effectively, adapting our processes, and ensuring we continued to meet and consistently exceed our SLAs throughout the transition.
